title.rendered: Top Scholarships in Sweden for International Students

content.rendered:
If you want to apply for scholarships in Sweden as an international student, you should read this post. Sweden is a great place to study. This country has really good universities in Europe for international students. These universities focus on research and provide excellent education to their students.

There are different types of scholarships in Sweden for students from other countries who choose to study or already study there.

Just like the scholarships in Sweden for students from other countries, there are also other scholarships and grants available for all students, not just international ones. These scholarships are provided by different countries. For instance, African students can find many scholarships in the United States of America.

The Mishkah Academy offers the International Arabic Scholarship Program to students who want to study Arabic online, whether they are Arab or not.

Scholarships in Sweden for International Students

1.  Swedish Institute for Global Professionals

The Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP) is part of the scholarships in Sweden for international students that are offered for full-time master’s level study in Sweden to highly qualified students from certain countries. It includes tuition, living expenses, and insurance.

2.  The Visby Programme Scholarships

Another one of the top 15 scholarships in Sweden for international students is the Visby Programme which makes available to master’s students a vast array of full scholarships in Sweden for international students indigenous to Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Moldova, Russia, and Ukraine

These scholarships cover tuition fees, living expenses to the tune of SEK 9,000 per month, insurance, and a one-time travel grant of SEK 5,000.

3. Blekinge Institute of Technology Scholarship Programme

The BHT Scholarships in Sweden for international students nursing to gain enrollment into any of the various institutions in Sweden are available to citizens from non-EU/EEA countries that are needed to pay tuition fees in any of the Swedish universities. The scholarship cover offered to students by this program is pegged at 50% of the tuition fees.

4. University of Borås Tuition Fee Waivers

University of Borås Tuition Fee Waivers offers tuition fee waivers to highly qualified students who otherwise would be required to pay tuition fees and are nursing aspirations of enrolling in eligible Master’s Programs at the university.

With 50% of the tuition fees to be covered this is a highly placed among the scholarships in Sweden for international students with the only drawback being its lack of coverage for the living costs of the students.

5. Chalmers IPOET Scholarships

With a 75% cover on tuition and fees incurred by the student’s admission into any of the Swedish institutions, the IPOET scholarships in Sweden for international students are designed and available to students and citizens of non-EU/EEA nations that are required to tuition fees, this is portioned for students nursing ambitions to enroll into any of the Master’s programs of the Chalmers Universities.

6.  Halmstad University Scholarships

Every year, Halmstad University awards to deserving candidates several scholarships in Sweden for international students from outside the EU/EEA and Switzerland who must pay tuition. These scholarships in Sweden for international students are for Master’s programs in any of the University’s fields of study. The Halmstad University Scholarship pays 25% or 50% of the tuition charge and is deducted from the fee.

7.  Karlstad University Global Scholarship Programme

This is one of the few scholarships in Sweden for international students that are awarded to citizens outside of the EU/EEA who would be required to pay the tuition fees for studies for those that have been accepted to be enrolled by the Karlstad University, for those eligible for the scholarship and have been confirmed for the scholarship, they can expect to get a full or partial reduction in the cost of tuition and other fees.

8.  KTH Royal Institute of Technology Tuition and fee Waivers

For those who are citizens of nations sitting outside of the EU/EEA/EFTA, a limited number of tuition fee waivers are available for students originating from these nations who would have otherwise been required to pay tuition fees in full, especially those who are nursing or have enrolled for any of the institute’s Master’s program.

One of the bonuses of this scholarship offer that differentiates it from the other scholarships in Sweden for international students is that once this offer is granted, the recipient student can expect this scholarship to cover the entire length of their program waiving the tuition costs.

9.   Karolinska Institutet Global Master’s Scholarship

Few numbers of scholarships in Sweden for international students provide a well-encompassing coverage as those offered by the Karolinska Institutet. The Karolinska Institutet Global Master’s Scholarship offers to excellent students a substantial amount of scholarship to cushion the effects of tuition costs of their Master’s offerings which takes effect at the start of every Autumn Semester.

The drag back of this scholarship is that it only covers the tuition costs accumulated by the students during the duration of their programs and not their living expenses and it is designed to only cater to students enrolled in the institute’s Master’s programs.

10. Linnaeus University Scholarships

Linnaeus University Scholarships are available to students from countries outside the EU/EEA and Switzerland who have applied to Linnaeus University for a study program. The scholarships typically pay 75% of the tuition cost, although a few Linnaeus Academy of Science and Business scholarships cover 100% of the tuition charge.
